# tidy data

load data

```{r}
  emissions <- readRDS("../../../r_data/emissions_factors.RDS")
  samples <- readRDS("../../../r_data/samples.RDS")
```

## format stove names

```{r}
  samples <-
    samples %>%
    dplyr::mutate(stove = 
                    stove %>% 
                    factor %>% 
                    gsub(" ", "\n",.) %>% 
                    forcats::fct_relevel("three\nstone\nfire",
                                         "clay\nring",
                                         "ceramic\ncharcoal",
                                         "rocket\nelbow",
                                         "built-in\njusta",
                                         "metal\ncharcoal",
                                         "fan\nrocket\nelbow",
                                         "gasifier",
                                         "wick\nkerosene",
                                         "pressure\nkerosene",
                                         "lpg"))
```

## add stove fuel info

```{r}
  emissions <-
    emissions %>%
    dplyr::left_join(samples %>%
                       dplyr::select(id, stove, fuel, stovecat), by = "id")
```

## select pollutants

```{r}
  carcinogens <-
    emissions %>%
    dplyr::filter(grepl("formaldehyde|^benzene$|acetaldehyde|b.a.pyrene", pol)) %>%
    dplyr::filter(metric == "energy_delivered_ef") %>%
    dplyr::mutate(pol = ifelse(grepl("benzene", pol), "benzene ", pol),
                  pol = ifelse(grepl("acetaldehyde", pol), "acetaldehyde ", pol),
                  pol = ifelse(grepl("b.a.pyrene", pol), "b[a]pyrene ", pol))
```

```{r}
 bap <-
  emissions %>%
  dplyr::filter(grepl("b.a.pyrene", pol)) %>%
  dplyr::filter(metric == "energy_delivered_ef")
```

# check for outliers

## formaldehyde

```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.width=10, fig.height=8}
  carcinogens %>%
    dplyr::filter(pol == "formaldehyde") %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = id, y = val, color = fuel)) +
    geom_point() +
    theme_bw() +
    theme(text = element_text(size = 12),
          legend.position = "top") +
    facet_wrap(~stove, scales = "free_x")
```

## calculate summary stats for gas phase carcinogens

```{r}
  range <-
    carcinogens %>%
    dplyr::select(-pol_category) %>%
    dplyr::filter(!grepl("b.a.pyrene", pol)) %>%
    tidyr::spread(pol, val) %>%
    na.omit %>%
    tidyr::gather(pol, val, 8:10) %>%
    dplyr::group_by(stove, id) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(val = sum(val, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
    dplyr::ungroup() %>%
    dplyr::group_by(stove) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(min = min(val, na.rm = TRUE),
                     max = max(val, na.rm = TRUE))
```

```{r}
  carcinogens <-
    carcinogens %>%
    dplyr::group_by(stove, stovecat, pol) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(val = median(val, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
    dplyr::left_join(range, by = "stove")
```

## calculate summary stats for bap

```{r}
  range_bap <-
    bap %>%
    na.omit %>%
    dplyr::group_by(stove, id) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(val = sum(val, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
    dplyr::ungroup() %>%
    dplyr::group_by(stove) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(min = min(val, na.rm = TRUE),
                     max = max(val, na.rm = TRUE))
```

```{r}
  bap <-
    bap %>%
    dplyr::group_by(stove, stovecat, pol) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(val = median(val, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
    dplyr::left_join(range_bap, by = "stove")
```

## plot: pollutant categories

```{r figure_3, echo=FALSE, fig.width=12, fig.height=5}
  carcinogens %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = stove, y = val, fill = pol)) +
    geom_histogram(stat = "identity") +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("#CCC999", "#2c7fb8", "#9999CC", "#66CC99")) +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = min, ymax = max), width = .2) +
    theme_bw() +
    theme(text = element_text(size = 18),
          legend.title = element_blank(),
          legend.text = element_text(size = 20),
          strip.text.x = element_text(size = 20),
          axis.title.y = element_text(size = 22),
          axis.text.x = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "top") +
    guides(fill = guide_legend(title = NULL)) +
    facet_grid(~stovecat, scales = "free", space = "free_x") +
    ylab("mg emitted per MJ delivered") +
    xlab("")
```
